page.title: 12 Habitats around our School
page.content: The residential development of our estate has provided an artificial environment for many birds. Blackbirds and Starlings nest in the school grounds and feed on the school fields and gardens. The tall trees around the nearby farmhouse have rooks nests and the birds feed from the fields and nearby lake area. Ladybirbs and caterpillars in abundance are found in the shrub borders by the pavements. The man-made lakes nearby provide food and home for a family of ducks. The food they eat is both artificial and natural.Swans also nest in the centre of the lakes and around the edges are the homes of water rats and an ant-hill.
